title: Develop a Mindset & Identify a Problem
description: Entrepreneurship starts with a mindset: resilience, curiosity, and a bias for action. Pay close attention to problems you or others face in daily life. A good business solves a real problem. Education (degree in any field) helps build skills, but is not a strict prerequisite.

title: Validate Your Idea & Build a Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
description: Before investing heavily, validate your idea. Talk to potential customers. Are they willing to pay for your solution? Build the simplest version of your product (the MVP) that solves the core problem. The goal is to learn as quickly and cheaply as possible.
institutes: Local incubators like Hatch Works, LAN

title: Launch, Iterate, and Find Product-Market Fit
description: Launch your MVP to a small group of early adopters. Gather feedback relentlessly and iterate on your product. The goal is to reach 'Product-Market Fit' - the point where you've built something a specific group of people truly want. This stage is about survival and finding your first real customers.

title: Scaling the Business & Building a Team
description: Once you have product-market fit, the focus shifts to growth (scaling). This involves hiring your first employees, building scalable processes for marketing and sales, and potentially seeking external funding (seed or Series A) to accelerate growth.
salaryRangeLKR: Founder's salary (depends on funding and revenue)
institutes: Venture Capital firms like Lanka Angel Network (LAN), BOV Capital

title: Mature Company Leadership
description: At this stage, your startup is becoming a mature company. Your role as a founder evolves from 'doing everything' to becoming a CEO who sets the vision, manages leadership, and steers the company's long-term strategy.
qualifications: A sustainable, profitable, or high-growth company
